results.title: Drummer Hoff
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, William L Snyder, Weston Woods Studios and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: This film is a lively folk verse about the building of a cannon called Sultan. Brightly dressed in full uniform each soldier brings a part of the remarkable machine. Based on the book by Ed and Barbara Emberley and adapted by Gene Deitch.

results.title: Drugstore cowboy
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Karen Murphy, Nick Wechsler and Avenue Pictures
results.brief_description: Gus Van Sant’s cynical but never moralistic story about a junkie couple whose domestic life centres on the pursuit of drugs. Matt Dillon and Kelly Lynch are outstanding as a couple of drifters who are not afraid to state their love for the pleasurable highs that drugs offer: compared to the existences of other people they meet in small-town America, they don’t think they are doing so badly. Alternating between the comic and the bleak, “Drugstore Cowboy” reveals the excess and pain of drug addiction but its sharp, cool and irreverent tone never condescends to, or patronises the viewer. Features an hilarious cameo by William Burroughs as a smacked-out priest.

results.title: Drugs: The Children are choosing - The Need for dialogue
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
Reports on a conference in which students and teachers have difficulties in communicating about drugs. Finally the frustrations and problems childhood emerge and it is suggested that it is no wonder young people turn to drugs for escape and pleasure.

results.title: Drugs: it's up to you really
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Nicholas Cockram, Lesley Hammond, South Australian Film Corporation and Telefeatures
results.brief_description: Groups of students talk about their own experiences with drugs, their attitudes towards drugs and the influences upon them to take various drugs especially cigarettes, alcohol and analgesics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Drugs: a primary film
results.brief_description: Presents vignettes of situations familiar to children to explore the correct use of drugs by the doctor and at home. Reveals the danger of drug misuse and emphasises the positive attitudes needed for a rich and healthy life. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Drugs, use or abuse
results.brief_description: Beginning with various types of beneficial drugs, the film moves to excessive use, stimulants and depressants, damaging chemicals in drugs, psychological dependence and forms of harmful drugs. Presents basic information about drugs and moves the viewer towards their own conclusion.

results.title: Drugs in our time
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The first film in the series looks at the socioeconomic setting of drug abuse. Seeks reasons for rising use of drugs among young people, and concludes that children are making choices and it is up to adults to prepare them for this.

results.title: Drugs Are Not the Problem
results.brief_description: In themselves drugs are not a problem but their abuse is. The film shows young people using various drugs and the penultimate consequence of addiction. There is a clear, diagrammatic representation of how the human mind and nervous system work and how drugs affect them. Above all, the film repeatedly points out that the human mind is capable of the greatest powers.
